questions.text: In "The Brokenwood Mysteries" TV show, who or what is Brokenwood?
questions.correct: It is a small New Zealand town
options: It is the name of a serial killer
It is the surname of the local chief detective
It is the name of a haunted hotel
questions.explanation:
It is a small New Zealand town.

	Brokenwood is a fictional New Zealand town with a population of about 5000 residents. It is mainly an agricultural community known for its vineyards. Although small, it has a wind farm, airstrip and other conveniences found in a big city. A minimum-security prison is also located there.

questions.text: To the chagrin of his co-workers, what genre of music is lead Detective Mike Shepherd partial to?
questions.explanation:
Country.

	Mike loves country music and encourages others to listen to it. He believes that country music helps him solve murder cases. He says that country music subject matter (passions, heartbreak, adultery, divorce, and jealousy) is never far from any murder he's ever investigated.

questions.text: From what country does Gina Kadinsky, the pathologist in the show "The Brokenwood Mysteries", come?
questions.explanation:
Russia.

	Dr. Kandinsky hails from Russia. She has been in New Zealand for about ten years. She often refers to her homeland when talking to others and has a crush on Shepherd.

questions.text: Which of the characters on "The Brokenwood Mysteries"  has a habit of talking to the corpse when arriving at a murder scene?
questions.explanation:
Mike Shepherd.

	When arriving at a murder scene, Shepherd usually kneels and has a little chat with the deceased, while the other officers awkwardly look on. Sometimes his conversations are humorous, like in the episode where he tells a man who had drowned in a wine vat that he "looked a little pink".

questions.text: The detectives on "The Brokenwood Mysteries" frequent a local pub owned by Ray Nielsen and his sister Trudy. What is the name of their pub?
questions.explanation:
The Frog and Cheetah.

	In addition to owning the Frog and Cheetah, Ray is co-owner of the "Lord of the Ringz" tours. His sister Trudy was found guilty of murder and spends time at the Brokenwood Women's Prison.

questions.text: In the TV show "The Brokenwood Mysteries", who is Mike Shepherd's "righthand man" (or woman)?
questions.explanation:
Kristin Sims.

	Kristin and Mike have a rocky start working together. Kristin is often flabbergasted at Mike's taste in music, his lack of professionalism and unorthodox detecting procedures. However, they work past their philosophical differences and make a powerful investigative duo. The role of Sims is played by New Zealand actress Fern Sutherland.

questions.text: In "The Brokenwood Mysteries" TV show, Mike Shepherd loves his Holden Kingwood. What is it?
questions.explanation:
A car.

	The Holden Kingswood is an Australian made full-size car made by the Holden Car Company, a subsidiary of General Motors. Shepherd's 1971 sedan is complete with cassette tape player where he plays his favorite music.

questions.text: In "The Brokenwood Mysteries" TV show, Detective Constable Daniel Chalmers refers to himself as DC/DC but jokingly says that because he is an awesome constable he should be referred to as ______. What goes in the blank?
questions.explanation:
AC/DC.

	Chalmers (played by Jarod Rawiri) replaces Sam Breen during season seven. He becomes a detective late in life, but his life experience and social work background makes him a savvy investigator. His sense of humor is seen in him referring to himself as DC/DC (because of his rank and name) or AC/DC because he calls himself an awesome constable.

questions.text: Which red-headed member of "The Brokenwood Mysteries" investigative team usually gets stuck contacting the show's more unusual suspects and has a girlfriend named Roxy?
questions.explanation:
Sam Breen.

	Breen is played by New Zealand comedian and actor Nic Sampson. On the show Breen comes from a family with a law enforcement background. He is often stuck doing the unpleasant parts of an investigation but becomes more passionate about his job. He moves away in season seven to be with his girlfriend Roxy, who moved to the Solomon Islands.

questions.text: In "The Brokenwood Mysteries" TV show, what is the nickname of local mechanic Frankie Oades? (Hint: Think "Lord of the Rings" and you should have this one in the "bag")
questions.explanation:
Frodo.

	Frankie "Frodo" Oades is a local resident that seems to be involved or connected to many of the show's murder cases. When he first appears on the show he has a job as a mechanic, but later he buys a food truck to sell his "Frodo Dogs".
